result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan Matthew Koerner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $250.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 15CM-376 and 15TR-2561 - Both Cases Called @ 3:16 PM: Defendant Bryan Matthew Koerner in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not want counsel today and is prepared to resolve these matters today.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 15CM-376 Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Upon motion of the State 15R-2561 DRI.  DA recommends guideline penalty.  Statement by Def:  Yes - DL reinstated and insurance obtained.  The Court:  Court Costs imposed - 60 DTP or PP; Bond to be applied - 60 DTP Bal.  Appeal Rights Given.  DNA sample to be provided today.
